intro: Helicteres dentata, commonly known as the toothed helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Helicteres dentata is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
